You wave your advisors away and decide to hear him out.\n\nThe man introduces himself as Philander and explains that he has a proposal for you. If you race for the Blues in the grand chariot race next week, he and his associates will make certain you win. You both stand to gain from this, with the glorious [Root.GetTitle] winning as a champion of the great Blue team.
An intriguing proposal... count me in.
By cheating? No thanks.
You refuse to take part in this scheme.
You practise chariot racing.
Practise Makes Perfect

You practise hard at chariot racing to better prepare for the upcoming event at the Atlanta Speedway. Despite managing well enough and only falling off the chariot a handful of times, you simply cannot see how you are supposed to beat the other professional racers. When you mention this to Philander, the little gnome of a man smiles and tells you not to worry. He assures you that the Greens, your main opponents, will not be a problem, and the other Blue racers have been instructed to let you win.\n\n"You had better be right about this," you tell Philander. "If I am made to look the fool, I swear I will not be the only one to suffer."
Let us get this over with.
To the Atlanta Speedway!
The Day of the Race

It is a fine day for racing and the Atlanta Speedway is packed with people wanting to see their [Root.GetTitle] conquer... or fail miserably in the attempt. Silvan, the star of the Greens, looks at you with scorn as your chariots line up. "I shall endeavour not to embarrass you too much, Your Imperial Majesty," he says through clenched teeth.\n\nThe trumpets blow, and the race begins! One by one, the Green chariots fall apart and topple over, giving you a clear path. Only Silvan's armored chariot remains of the Green team, but as your Blue allies move to block him, their chariots disintegrate as well. It seems both teams had the same idea. Still, you skillfully navigate through the wreckage and manage to hold off Silvan long enough to win the race!
Victory, but not thanks to Philander!
The Day of the Race

It is a fine day for racing and the Atlanta Speedway is packed with people wanting to see their [Root.GetTitle] conquer... or fail miserably in the attempt. Silvan, the star of the Greens, looks at you with scorn as your chariots line up. "I shall endeavour not to embarrass you too much, Your Imperial Majesty," he says through clenched teeth.\n\nThe trumpets blow, and the race begins! One by one, the Green chariots fall apart and topple over, giving you a clear path. Only Silvan's armored chariot remains of the Green team, but as your Blue allies move to block him, their chariots disintegrate as well. It seems both teams had the same idea. Without their aid, Silvan steers his chariot past you and wins the race!
Defeat! Philander will pay!
The Day of the Race

It is a fine day for racing and the Atlanta Speedway is packed with people wanting to see their [Root.GetTitle] conquer... or fail miserably in the attempt. Silvan, the star of the Greens, looks at you with scorn as your chariots line up. "I shall endeavour not to embarrass you too much, Your Imperial Majesty," he says through clenched teeth.\n\nThe trumpets blow, and the race begins! One by one, the Green chariots fall apart and topple over, giving you a clear path. Only Silvan's armored chariot remains of the Green team, but as your Blue allies move to block him, their chariots disintegrate as well. It seems both teams had the same idea. The furious crowds storm the arena in disgust at this blatant attempt by both teams to cheat!
Back! Back, I say!
The chariot race has concluded.
Another Proposal...

As you walk at a brisk pace through an empty corridor in the Imperial Palace, on your way to another tiring meeting with your advisors, you hear a faint whisper from one of the window curtains. After readying your dagger you pull the curtains aside to reveal Philander, the gnome-man who recruited you into chariot racing!\n\n"You! I should have you drawn and quartered," you hiss at the man. "The entire Blue team had their chariots fall out from under them!" Philander smiles at you, and speaks: "Calm yourself, Majesty. Your chariot held together, did it not? I have a new and cunning plan for the next race - one that cannot fail. Your epic victory will be celebrated for centuries to come."
I may regret this, but I will join this scheme.
Not interested. Guards, haul this wretched creature away!
Philander is thrown into the dungeons and you put this vile scheme behind you for good.
You resume your training.
Training Resumes

You resume your chariot training and although you are an even better racer now, it still may not be enough to best the other competitors, many of whom have been driving chariots since early childhood. Philander approaches to tell you of his new scheme.\n\n"Behold, Majesty," he says, and produces a small bottle from within his cloak. "One drop of this concoction, which my associates and I only acquired at great cost I might add, is enough to send a man running for the latrines within minutes. Each member of the Green team will be offered some spiced wine by their quartermaster - a man in our employ - just before the race is about to begin. I think you can see where I am going with this, Your Grace..."
Good. This might actually work!
The Day of the Second Race

Once again you ride into the Atlanta Speedway in your chariot to the cheers of the people. It looks like nearly all of Atlanta has turned up for this momentous race. Silvan, your old nemesis, is instructing the rest of the Green team when their quartermaster offers them a sip of wine to fortify their resolve. All accept this offer, except Silvan. Instead, he loudly proclaims, he will offer his wine to the Blue team who need it more. Before you can object, the other Blue racers happily share the wine between them...\n\nThe trumpets blare and the race begins. Within seconds the first few racers leap off their chariots, sprinting for the latrines. Soon only you and Silvan remain. Fortune favours you, however, as Silvan collides with the last racer to abandon his chariot. This delays him enough to grant you victory!
Victory, but no thanks to Philander!
The Day of the Second Race

Once again you ride into the Atlanta Speedway in your chariot to the cheers of the people. It looks like nearly all of Atlanta has turned up for this momentous race. Silvan, your old nemesis, is instructing the rest of the Green team when their quartermaster offers them a sip of wine to fortify their resolve. All accept this offer, except Silvan. Instead, he loudly proclaims, he will offer his wine to the Blue team who need it more. Before you can object, the other Blue racers happily share the wine between them...\n\nThe trumpets blare and the race begins. Within seconds the first few racers leap off their chariots, sprinting for the latrines. Soon only you and Silvan remain and sadly for you, he proves to be the better chariot racer. He overtakes you in the final lap and rides his chariot to victory.
Confound it all!
The Day of the Second Race

Once again you ride into the Atlanta Speedway in your chariot to the cheers of the people. It looks like nearly all of Atlanta has turned up for this momentous race. Silvan, your old nemesis, is instructing the rest of the Green team when their quartermaster offers them a sip of wine to fortify their resolve. All accept this offer, except Silvan. Instead, he loudly proclaims, he will offer his wine to the Blue team who need it more. Before you can object, the other Blue racers happily share the wine between them...\n\nThe trumpets blare and the race begins. Within seconds the first few racers leap off their chariots, sprinting for the latrines. Soon only you and Silvan remain, but the crowd is up in arms over this disgraceful display. It is obvious to all that foul play is involved. They jump into the arena!
Back, knaves!
One Sunny Afternoon...

You enjoy a quiet moment away from your advisors under the shade of a tree in the palatial garden. A sound from above catches your attention, and as you look up you spot Philander, the chariot gnome, hiding on a branch. "Your Grace," he whispers with a smile. "Before I suffer your wrath, I ask that you hear me out."\n\nHe scurries down from the tree and gives you his new offer. "Fate may have conspired against us in the past, Majesty, but this time my plan is foolproof." He flashes a toothless grin, the closest he can manage to a winning smile. "Third time's the charm, eh, Your Majesty? What do you say?"
It had better be. I am in.
You must be joking. Guards!
The Chariot

Philander brings you to a small workshop in one of the seedier districts of Atlanta. Here, he explains, they will weaponize your chariot. While you watch, the craftsmen install a pair of extendable metal blades into its chassis, intended to shred the wheels of any chariot adjacent to yours.\n\nYou train extensively with the new chariot until you have mastered its new weapons. As you are about to leave for the Atlanta Speedway on the eve of the race, Philander hands you a flanged mace. "For good measure," he explains.
Let us hope it does not come to that.
The Day of the Third Race

This is it, the final race of the season. The Atlanta Speedway is filled to capacity and a deafening roar greets you as you ride your chariot into the arena. You line up next to Silvan, your old foe from the Greens and the crowd's favorite. "Your Majesty," he says and spits on the ground.\n\nThe trumpets blow and the race begins, but it seems you weren't the only one to have brought arms. Everything turns into a huge melee as all the drivers hack and slash at each other using both handheld and chariot-mounted weaponry. Philander has played both sides against each other - there can be no other explanation. The situation escalates further when the agitated crowds enter the fray. You spot Philander climbing into Silvan's chariot, and the two of them escape the Atlanta Speedway through the unguarded exit.
Give chase!
Stay behind.
You remain at the Atlanta Speedway to stifle this riot.
Aftermath

As Silvan and the traitor Philander depart the Atlanta Speedway leaving nothing but chaos in their wake, you rally the Knights of the Golden Circle to your side. Together with a squadron of Southern Knights from the nearby garrison you finally manage to bring order to the madness. The cost of life is great, especially amongst the audience, but it can't be helped.\n\nYour career as a chariot racer is over, but despite everything, you have emerged through all this as the strongwilled leader many feel the Confederacy needs. You wonder what possible motive compelled Philander to turn the Blue and Green factions against each other in open battle. For how long did he mastermind events with that purpose in mind? You will likely never know. He is now a wanted man throughout the Confederacy.
Bloody gnome.
You pursue them outside the Atlanta Speedway.
The Chase Is On

You leave the madness of the Race Track behind and steer your chariot out into the streets of Atlanta, in hot pursuit of Silvan and the traitor Philander. With blades unfolded, your chariot smashes through market stalls and pottery in the narrow back alleys while a hissing Philander tries to give you a taste of the whip, without success.\n\nYou rush past the Stone Mountain and into the Antebellum Plantation as terrified deacons scramble to get out of the way. With a sharp turn you continue forward on highway 78, the main thoroughfare, and speed past oxcarts and the Forum of Atlanta before Silvan abruptly turns north, towards Johns Creek. He finally loses control of his chariot at a small market, and it crashes into some stacked crates. You step out of your chariot and draw your mace.
Give no quarter.
Show mercy.
You show mercy.
No Quarter Given

Silvan has been impaled on a nearby fence and his dead eyes glare at you accusingly. Philander, however, lies wheezing on the docks with a broken leg. He curses your name as you approach him with your mace. "Why do all this?" you ask him. "What could you possibly gain?"\n\nThe little man grins wryly at you. "Eons ago, there were four chariot racing teams: the Blues, the Greens, the Whites and the Reds. Then the two most powerful teams all but absorbed the two weakest. Who speaks of the Whites today? Or the Reds? Where is their glory? The domination of the Blues and Greens had to end, Majesty. At any cost. If my nephew Silvan and I could get them to wipe each other out..." You have heard enough. With a single blow, your mace forever silences Philander.
One less headache for me.
You show no mercy.
Quarter Is Given

Silvan has been impaled on a nearby fence and his dead eyes glare at you accusingly. Philander, however, lies wheezing on the docks with a broken leg. He curses your name as you approach him with your mace. "Why do all this?" you ask him. "What could you possibly gain?"\n\n The little man grins wryly at you. "Eons ago, there were four chariot racing teams: the Blues, the Greens, the Whites and the Reds. Then the two most powerful teams all but absorbed the two weakest. Who speaks of the Whites today? Or the Reds? The domination of the Blues and Greens had to end, Majesty. At any cost. If my nephew Silvan and I could get them to wipe each other out..." You have heard enough. Knights of the Golden Circle on horseback finally catch up with you and are instructed to take Philander away.
And throw away the key.
Atlanta is engulfed in riots!
The city is beset by rioters and hooligans.
Riots in Atlanta

Members of the Knights of the Golden Circle leap into the arena in defense of their [Root.GetTitle] and swiftly cut down those rioters foolish enough to approach your chariot. They rush you to the safety of your palace, but the rest of Atlanta burns when the upset crowds spill out of the race track and onto the streets. As you watch the fires spread from a balcony, you raise your fists to the heavens and bellow at the top of your lungs:\n\n"PHIIILAAAANDEEEEERRRRR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"
When I get my hands on him...

Chariot races are scheduled to be held soon at the Atlanta Speedway. Eight charioteers from the traditional Blue and Green teams will be competing for glory on the track. You may choose to throw your weight behind one of these factions and bet on them in a show of support.
Support the Blues.
Support the Greens.
I have no time for silly games.
You wash your hands of chariot racing.
the Blue team winning.

It was close, but the Blue team emerged as the winner after a tense final lap. Their triumphant charioteer makes a victory lap to the cheers of the ecstatic crowds. When he passes your seat he bows his head as a sign of respect and gratitude.
I know how to pick a winner.
the Blue team losing.

The Blue team lost the race after a nail-biting final lap. To the cheers of the crowd, the triumphant Green charioteer makes a victory lap. As he passes your seat, he flashes a gloating smile and gives you a little wave. Fortunately, your quick-thinking servants remove your wine cup before you can hurl it at him.
That little...!
the Green team winning.

It was close, but the Green team emerged as the winner after a tense final lap. Their triumphant charioteer makes a victory lap to the cheers of the ecstatic crowds. When he passes your seat he bows his head as a sign of respect and gratitude.
I know how to pick a winner.
the Green team losing.

The Green team lost the race after a nail-biting final lap. To the cheers of the crowd, the triumphant Blue charioteer makes a victory lap. As he passes your seat, he flashes a gloating smile and gives you a little wave. Fortunately, your quick-thinking servants remove your wine cup before you can hurl it at him.
That little...!
Start planning the theft of the §YStone of Golgotha§!!
Start planning the theft of the §YHorn of Gabriel§!!
Start planning the theft of the §YFragment of the True Cross§!!
Start planning the theft of the §YWeeping Statue§!!
Start planning the theft of the §YRight Hand of Petrus Romanus§!!
Start planning the theft of the §YLeft Hand of the Lubavitcher Rebbe§!!
Start planning the theft of the §YGolden Menorah§!!
Start planning the theft of the §YAncient Bonsai§!!
Start planning the theft of the §YGolden Oscar§!!
Sagas
was mauled to death by a panther on the order of $KILLER$
was mauled to death by a panther

Now that the city of Georgetown is once again in Hindu hands, steps must be taken to ensure that does not fall again. It may be prudent to create an order of warriors that is dedicated to defending the Hindu faith.
Religious Head Instituted
There suddenly seems to be an awful lot of these [From.TrueReligion.GetTrueReligionAdherent]s...
column3: Il semble y avoir soudainement énormément de personnes de foi [From.TrueReligion.GetName]...
column4: Urplötzlich scheint es furchtbar viele dieser [From.TrueReligion.GetName]en Glaubensanhänger zu geben ...
column6: De repente, parece haber una cantidad enorme de fieles del credo [From.TrueReligion.GetName].

column2: [First Coast S-Mart permission request. You shouldn't see this. Please notify Dryhad]
[Chicago S-Mart permission request. You shouldn't see this. Please notify Dryhad]
[Seattle S-Mart permission request. You shouldn't see this. Please notify Dryhad]
[Alameda S-Mart permission request. You shouldn't see this. Please notify Dryhad]
[Merrimack S-Mart permission request. You shouldn't see this. Please notify Dryhad]
They have my blessing.
column3: Ils ont ma bénédiction.
column4: Sie haben meinen Segen.
column6: Tienen mi bendición.

column2: Not on my watch!
column3: Jamais sous mon règne !
column4: Mit mir nicht!
column6: ¡No bajo mi supervisión!

column2: You permit the formation of S-Mart.
You refuse the formation of S-Mart.
The Rise of S-Mart

Several Consumerist faithful and entrepreneurs have come together in [From.MercRepCapital.GetName] to form S-Mart, the one stop outlet for everything you'll ever need. This loose confederation of franchise stores is dedicated towards the continued prosperity of its members and the mutual defense of any merchant vessels flying its flag. Their eventual and unstated goal, of course, is to one day completely dominate all trade throughout North America...
That's bound to ruffle some feathers...
column3: Ça ne manquera pas de froisser quelques plumes...
column4: Das wird bestimmt einige verärgern.
column6: Seguro que esto causará irritación...

column2: A new rival!
column3: Un nouveau rival !
column4: Ein neuer Rivale!
column6: ¡Un nuevo rival!

column2: I wasn't sure what to do, when [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] himself whispered to me. I should talk to one of the denizens of my dungeon.  As I listened to the prisoner's appeal for mercy [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] whispered to me once more that they weren't very sincere. Perchance a little time on the rack would help him.
column3: Je ne savais pas que faire lorsque [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] en personne a chuchoté à mon oreille. Il me fallait m'entretenir avec un des occupants de mon donjon. Alors que j'écoutais les déchirants suppliques du captif demandant pitié, le [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] a, une nouvelle fois, chuchoté à mon oreille qu'il n'était pas sincère. Je devrais peut-être le soumettre à la torture.
column4: Ich wusste nicht, was ich tun sollte, als [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] selbst mir zuflüsterte, dass ich mit einem Insassen meines Kerkers sprechen sollte. Als ich zuhörte, wie der Gefangene um Gnade flehte, flüsterte mir Satan zu, dass er nicht besonders aufrichtig sei. Vielleicht wäre eine Weile auf der Streckbank für ihn eine Hilfe?
column6: No sabía muy bien qué hacer cuando el mismo [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] me estaba susurrando. Debería hablar con algún habitante de mi mazmorra.  Mientras el prisionero pedía piedad, [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] me habló una vez más y me dijo que no era sincero. Quizás le venga bien pasar un rato en el potro de tortura.

column2: Kneel Before the Emperor

It has become customary for rulers within Brazil's sphere of influence to travel to the royal court in Rio de Janeiero and show their allegiance to the Emperor personally. Perhaps it is time I went on a trip to Brazil...

A traveler from the south reaches your court along with his personal bodyguard. Reading from parchment, he states that the August Emperor of Brazil demands a tribute of a thousand 'ublemished horses' from your lands.

Another envoy from Brazil arrives at your court. He tells you that he himself is a gift - a token of gratitude from the Emperor - and that he is an excellent governor of trade if you need his services.
I've noticed an increase in traders coming from the south since I employed [chinese_envoy.GetBestName] as a trade governor.

You are out taking a walk together with [FromFrom.GetFirstName] when [From.GetFirstName] approaches you with a concern. According to Brazilian law [From.GetSheHe] is required to get a woman to continue his services more permanently. You're not sure if this is actually a provision of Brazilian law, but he insists that he's serious.
After finding a holy relic, the emboldened Christian defenders of §Y[From.Siege.GetName]§! caused havoc on the antiquarian siege lines in a daring raid.
A mystic has heartened the defenders of §Y[From.Siege.GetName]§!, and they have inflicted severe losses on the besieging infidels.
God's wrath will be upon him.
Sympathy for [jewish_group.GetGroupName] religions
column3: Sympathie pour la religion [jewish_group.GetGroupName]
column4: Sympathie für [jewish_group.GetGroupName]e Religionen
column6: Simpatía hacia las religiones [jewish_group.GetGroupName]

column2: This character, though not [jewish_group.GetGroupName], has a special sympathy and understanding for the [jewish_group.GetGroupName] faith and its practitioners.
column3: Ce personnage, bien qu'il ne soit pas de foi [jewish_group.GetGroupName], montre une certaine tolérance et une compréhension relative de cette religion et de ses pratiquants.
column4: Dieser Charakter, obwohl nicht selbst [jewish_group.GetName], hat eine besondere Sympathie und ein besonderes Verständnis für die [jewish_group.GetGroupName]e Religion und seine Anhänger.
column6: Este personaje, aun sin ser [jewish_group.GetName], siente una simpatía y comprensión especial hacia la fe [jewish_group.GetGroupName] y sus practicantes.

column2: The key fits the lock, and trembling with anticipation you slowly open the chest. It is filled with ancient silver coins, carved with the likeness of the long-dead Presidents of America and words written in their strange language!

You meet with your vassals and [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s Judges in the middle of [converting_king.Capital.GetName]'s square.\nAddressing the crowd of commoners gathered all around you, you publicly denounce the old gods and spit on their false idols, gesturing for your vassals to do the same. A few complaints rise from the crowd, but they are swiftly quelled. Then, as the Judges destroy the icons, you declare your loyalty to America and its Founders.\nYou all turn towards the red, white, and blue flag brought by Judges, place your hands over your hearts, and recite the Pledge of Allegiance.

The hooded priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] arrive at dawn, but the ceremony begins only after sunset, once they have helped the icons of the new gods adjust to their new home in your temple.\nYou meet with your vassals outside the city, a crowd of your subjects assembling all around you, and then, under the grim echoes of drums and horns, the Norse priests begin the rite. They paint your faces with the blood of the sacrificial lambs, burn sacred herbs and chant their secret spells, as you all enter a trance.\nVisions of horror and delight accompany you for the rest of the night. When you wake at dawn of the next day, the priests are already gone. Little by little, the confused crowd of converts returns to [converting_king.Capital.GetName].

Following the instructions of [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s priests, you assemble your vassals and journey away from [converting_king.Capital.GetName] in a large procession.\nThe Revelationist priests lead you away from the civilized roads, deep into the wilderness, refusing to answer to any query about your destination.\nAfter riding for the entire day, you stop in a clearing, surrounded by a dense forest. The priests burn a few offerings of animal fat to the Light, creating a large line of dark smoke from a small set of fires. Then, as their chants echo through the air, you walk with your vassals through the smoke and cleanse yourself of the old gods.

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] arrive at dawn, carrying strange metal instruments and artifacts. When the time comes they lead you and your vassals to an old, rusted ruin near [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of your subjects waiting nearby. \nThe priests instruct you to wait and quickly enter the ruin. After what feels like hours, the ruin, miraculously, lights up, steam churning from its ancient smokestacks. You and your vassals proclaim on the spot that your old gods are dead, and swear an oath of loyalty to the Omnissah. The priests lead the crowd into the factory and instruct them in the rituals required to operate it, enduring until the sun begins to set and the factory finally shuts down. When the day is over, they proclaim that you are now workers for the Omnissah.

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at sunset. When the time comes you meet your vassals at the top of a cliff outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of your subjects waiting below. \nThe priests start the ceremony by chanting in a language foreign to you, in an attempt to summon the Old Ones. When the last rays of sun disappear in the distance you and your vassals hear a low, otherworldly bellow in the distance. The bellows continue as the priests begin chanting at an ever louder and more frantic pace. When dawn finally comes, they proclaim that the Old Ones must be pleased, as nobody present has died or gone mad, and welcome you into the faith.

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at sunset. When the time comes you meet your vassals at the top of a cliff outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of your subjects waiting below. \nThe priests start the ceremony by proclaiming that, contrary to what many of your subjects have believed, they may continue worshiping their old pantheon, as long as they swear an oath of allegiance to the Queen. They then begin reciting ancient Thelemic passages, instructing you and your followers on how to realize their True Will. When the last rays of sun reappear in the distance, you and your vassals swear a final oath, and become true Thelemites

The druids from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at sunset. When the time comes you meet your vassals at the top of a cliff outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of your subjects waiting below. \nThe druids start the ceremony chanting and playing their sacred instruments. When the last rays of sun disappear in the distance you and your vassals proclaim that your old gods are dying with this day. The druids resume their singing and dancing, enduring for the entirety of the night, even after most of the common crowd has fallen asleep. When dawn comes, they proclaim that you are reborn with the new day under the protection of the Dagda.

The conversion of [converting_king.Capital.GetName] starts on a warm morning.\nThe Padre leading [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s embassy meets you at a river near the city. Your faithful vassals stand beside you, while the rest of your subjects wait their turn behind them, looking still visibly confused. The Padre recites a few verses from [sacred_heart.GetScriptureName] before you lead your vassals into the river. As you pass the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] padres they baptize you, one after the other, in the river's water. It takes some prodding from the guards to convince the peasants to follow you into the water, but, after a while, the entire crowd stands soaked and shaking by the riverside, just in time to watch the padres and their helpers drop your old idols into the waves.\n"As the false visages are swallowed by the tides" the Padre proclaims, "may their memory forever be banished from your soul."

The conversion of [converting_king.Capital.GetName] starts on a cold morning.\nThe Apostle leading [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s embassy meets you at a river near the city. Your faithful vassals stand beside you, while the rest of your subjects wait their turn behind them, looking still visibly confused. The Apostle recites a few verses from [mormon.GetScriptureName] before you lead your vassals into the river. As you pass the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests they baptize you, one after the other, in the cold water. It takes some prodding from the guards to convince the peasants to follow you into the water, but, after a while, the entire crowd stands soaked and shaking by the riverside, just in time to watch the priests and their helpers drop your old idols into the waves.\n"As the false visages are swallowed by the tides" the Apostle proclaims, "may their memory forever be banished from your soul."

The [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests arrive at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] with a luxurious parade, carrying the tall, golden idol to The Dollar to the center of your capital. \nYou meet them with your vassals, surrounded by a crowd of commoners, and publicly renounce your old gods before bowing to the golden idol. \nOne by one, you order your offerings of gold and precious stones to be delivered unto the new god, covering his idol little by little with increasingly more opulent garments. After you and your vassals have finished with your donations, some of the people from the crowd join in as well, leaving what little they have at the feet of the idol as it is carried inside its new home.

The [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] professors arrive a few days before the ceremony in order to settle in their new temple.\nFor all the remaining days before the event, you and your vassals find yourself stuck listening to an endless list of rules and rituals that the priests swear you must absolutely know in order to correctly worship [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetHighGodName] without suffering any ill effects. When the day for the mass conversion comes, the ceremony itself looks almost like an afterthought in comparison to the bureaucratic preparation. The professors quickly cleanse all old icons publicly and allow you to renounce your old gods before hiding back inside the temple and resuming their private rituals.

Although the Founders built their nation from war, it is a commendable feat for you to have converted an entire score of pagans through words only. \nYou have no doubts that traitors still hide in [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s domain, but now that the ruling class has been brought into the light, it is only a matter of time until everybody else in the realm follows. With the mass conversion of [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName], you have helped manifest the great American destiny.

The priests sent to introduce the Light to the strange people of [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have returned bringing good news. \n[converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] has sealed [converting_king.GetHerHis] allegiance with the Spirit and now [converting_king.GetHerHis] whole people live under its protection. \nAs long as they will follow the rite and placate the Spirit, they have opened themselves a road to a bright and prosperous future under its providence.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to your gods and to teach them how to placate the spirits of industry surrounding them. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and please the gods according to tradition, lest ill luck befall them.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to your Old Ones and to teach them how to placate the eldritch beings of the deep surrounding them. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and placate the Old Ones according to tradition, lest madness befall them.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to Thelema and to teach them how to follow their True Will. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and follow The Law, lest ill luck befalls them.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to your gods and to teach them how to placate teh spirits of the wild surrounding them. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and please the gods according to tradition, lest ill luck befalls them.

You receive news from your missionaries only a few days after the mass baptism of [converting_king.Capital.GetName]. Although the padre writes that he does not feel entirely convinced about the sincerity of the barbarians' conversion, the ceremony went well and [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is now officially [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName].\nBy aiding in the conversion of an entire score of pagans to the One True Faith, you have accomplished a feat worthy of the Saints themselves.

You receive news from your missionaries only a few days after the mass baptism of [converting_king.Capital.GetName]. Although the priest writes that he does not feel entirely convinced about the sincerity of the barbarians' conversion, the ceremony went well and [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is now officially [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName].\nBy aiding in the conversion of an entire score of pagans to the One True Faith, you have accomplished a feat worthy of the Smith himself.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to Capitalism. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and please the Almighty Dollar according to tradition, lest ill luck befall them.

Your professors have returned bringing news from [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName].\nThe local tribes have been successfully introduced to the worship of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. \nWith the proper grooming, they will become model followers of the true faith, given enough time.

You meet with your liege and [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s Judges in the middle of [converting_king.Capital.GetName]'s square.\nAddressing the crowd of commoners reunited all around you, [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] publicly denounces the old gods and spits on their false idols, gesturing for your and the [converting_king.GetHerHis] vassals to do the same. A few complaints rise from the crowd, but they are swiftly quelled. Then, as the Judges destroy the icons, you pledge your allegiance to the United States of America.\nYou all turn to face the red, white, and blue flag and place your hands over your hearts.

Following the instructions of [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s priests, [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] summons you and [converting_king.GetHerHis] other vassals and travel out of [converting_king.Capital.GetName] in a great procession.\nThe Revelationist priests lead you away from the civilized roads, deep into the wilderness, refusing to answer to any query about your destination.\nAfter riding for the entire day, you stop in a forest clearing. The priests burn a few offerings of animal fat to the Light, creating a large line of dark smoke from a small set of fires. Then, as their chants echo through the air, you all walk through the smoke following your liege and cleanse yourself of the old gods.

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at dawn. When the time comes you meet your liege outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of [converting_king.GetHerHis] subjects waiting near a rusted ruin. \nThe priests start the ceremony chanting and operating their sacred instruments. Suddenly, the ruin lights up, and steam begins pouring from the smokestack. The priests teach you how to maintain the factory, continuing until the factory finally shuts down. When the sun begins to set, they proclaim that you are now workers for the Omnissah.

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at sunset. When the time comes you meet your liege at the top of a cliff outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of [converting_king.GetHerHis] subjects waiting below. \nThe priests start the ceremony by chanting in a strange tongue. When the last rays of sun disappear in the distance you all hear a low, otherworldly bellowing in the distance. The priests begin chanting louder and more frantically, enduring for the entirety of the night, until the bellowing subsides. When dawn comes, they proclaim that the Old Ones have accepted you as worshipers and welcome you to the Occultist faith.

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at sunset. When the time comes you meet your liege at the top of a cliff outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of [converting_king.GetHerHis] subjects waiting below. \nThe priests start the ceremony by explaining how to follow your "True Will". When the last rays of sun disappear in the distance you all proclaim your allegiance to the Thelemic Queen. The priests recite ancient Thelemic precepts, enduring for the entirety of the night, even after most of the common crowd has fallen asleep. When dawn comes, they proclaim that you are now Thelemites.

The druids from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at sunset. When the time comes you meet your liege at the top of a cliff outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of [converting_king.GetHerHis] subjects waiting below. \nThe druids start the ceremony creating a large fire with your offerings in order to satiate the spirits. When the last rays of sun disappear in the distance you all proclaim that your old gods are dying with this day. The druids resume their singing and dancing, enduring for the entirety of the night, even after most of the common crowd has fallen asleep. When dawn comes and the pillar of smoke finally vanishes, they proclaim that the Dagda has accepted your offering and welcome you under his protection.

The conversion of [converting_king.Capital.GetName] starts on a warm morning.\nThe Padre leading [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s embassy meets your liege at a river near the city. You stand beside [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName], while [converting_king.GetHerHis] subjects wait their turn behind you, looking still visibly confused. The Padre recites a few verses from the Bible, then [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] leads you all in the river while the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests baptize you as you pass by them. It takes some prodding from the guards to convince the peasants to follow you into the water, but, after a while, the entire crowd stands soaked and shaking by the riverside, just in time to watch the priests and their helpers drop your old idols into the waves.\n"As the false visages are swallowed by the tides," the Padre proclaims, "may their memory forever be banished from your soul."

The conversion of [converting_king.Capital.GetName] starts on a cold morning.\nThe Apostle leading [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s embassy meets your liege at a river near the city. You stand beside [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName], while [converting_king.GetHerHis] subjects wait their turn behind you, looking still visibly confused. The Apostle recites a few verses from the Book of Mormon, then [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] leads you all in the river while the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests baptize you as you pass by them. It takes some prodding from the guards to convince the peasants to follow you into the water, but, after a while, the entire crowd stands soaked and shaking by the riverside, just in time to watch the priests and their helpers drop your old idols into the waves.\n"As the false visages are swallowed by the tides," the Apostle proclaims, "may their memory forever be banished from your soul."

The [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests arrive at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] with a luxurious parade, carrying the tall, golden idol of the Almighty Dollar to the center of [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s capital. \nYou meet them with your liege and [converting_king.GetHerHis] other vassals, surrounded by a crowd of commoners, and publicly renounce your old gods before bowing to the golden idol. \nOne by one, [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] orders your offerings of gold and precious stones to be delivered unto the new god, covering his statue little by little with increasingly more opulent garments. After you have all finished with your donations, some of the people from the crowd join in as well, leaving what little they have at the feet of the idol as it is carried inside its new home.

The [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] professors arrive a few days before the ceremony in order to settle in their new temple.\nFor all the remaining days before the event, you and your liege find yourself stuck listening to an endless list of rules and rituals that the professors swear you must absolutely know in order to correctly worship [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetHighGodName] without suffering any ill effects. When the day for the mass conversion comes, the ceremony itself looks almost like an afterthought in comparison to the bureaucratic preparation. The professors quickly cleanse all old icons publicly and allow you to renounce your old gods before hiding back inside the temple and resuming their private rituals.

[converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] and all of [converting_king.GetHerHis] spineless new converts have reunited at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] to destroy the statues of the old gods and convert to Americanism. \nThe once proud people of [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have been forced to watch their gods be humiliated and destroyed by foreign priests with the approval of their own [converting_king.GetTitle]. \nYou can only imagine what sort of indignities the foreign priests subjected them to, but you are certain that now it is only a matter of time before the shadow of the stars and stripes reaches [Root.Capital.GetName].

[converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] and all of [converting_king.GetHerHis] spineless new converts have reunited at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] to embrace the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] gods. \nAccording to most accounts, the foreign priests have employed a vile ritual to summon evil spirits to control and twist the minds of your liege and the other converts.\nYou can only imagine what sort of indignities the foreign priests subjected them to, but you are certain that now it is only a matter of time before this new religion forces its way to [Root.Capital.GetName].
column3: [converting_king.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] et tous ses nouveaux convertis sans convictions se sont réunis à [converting_king.Capital.GetName] pour embrasser les dieux [sponsoring_king.GetReligionMascPl].\nSelon les récits de l'événement, les prêtres étrangers ont procédé à un infâme rituel pour faire venir les esprits maléfiques afin de posséder les âmes de votre [Root.Liege.GetLordLady] lige et des autres convertis.\nVous pouvez seulement imaginer à quel genre d'indignités les prêtres étrangers les ont soumis, mais vous êtes certain que ce n'est plus qu'une question de temps avant que cette nouvelle religion s'impose à [Root.Capital.GetName].
column4: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] und alle [converting_king.GetHerHis]er rückgratlosen neuen Konvertierten haben sich in [converting_king.Capital.GetName] getroffen, um die [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName]en Götter anzunehmen.\nDen meisten Berichten zufolge, haben die ausländischen Priester ein abscheuliches Ritual angewandt, um böse Geister zu beschwören, die die Gedanken Eures Lehnsherrn und der anderen Konvertierten kontrollieren und verdrehen.\nIhr könnt Euch nur vorstellen, welche Art der Demütigungen die ausländischen Priester ihnen zufügten, aber Ihr seid sicher, dass es nur eine Frage der Zeit ist, bis die neue Religion ihren Schatten auch auf [Root.Capital.GetName] wirft.
column6: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] y todos sus nuevos conversos sin agallas se reunieron en [converting_king.Capital.GetName] para adoptar los dioses [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName]. \nSegún la mayoría de los relatos, los sacerdotes extranjeros usaron un ritual inmundo para invocar espíritus maligno que controlasen y alterasen las mentes de tu señor y los otro conversos.\nNi te imaginas a qué indignidades les habrán sometido los sacerdotes extranjeros, pero ya solo es cuestión de tiempo que esta nueva religión se abra paso en [Root.Capital.GetName].

column2: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] and all of [converting_king.GetHerHis] spineless new converts have reunited at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] to be baptized by a [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priest. \nThe once proud people of [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have been led like cattle through a river while the blasphemous ceremony took place above them. \nYou can only imagine what sort of indignities the foreign priests subjected them to, but you are certain that now it is only a matter of time before the shadow of the cross reaches [Root.Capital.GetName].
column3: [converting_king.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] et tous ses nouveaux convertis sans convictions se sont réunis à [converting_king.Capital.GetName] pour être baptisés par un prêtre [sponsoring_king.GetReligionMasc].\nLe peuple autrefois fier [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] a été mené comme du bétail à un fleuve où a eu lieu la cérémonie blasphématoire.\nVous pouvez seulement imaginer à quel genre d'indignités les prêtres étrangers l'ont soumis, mais vous êtes certain que ce n'est plus qu'une question de temps avant que l'ombre de la croix ne plane au-dessus de [Root.Capital.GetName].
column4: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] und alle [converting_king.GetHerHis]er rückgratlosen neuen Konvertierten haben sich in [converting_king.Capital.GetName] getroffen, um von einem [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName]en Priester getauft zu werden.\nDas einst stolze Volk von [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] wurde wie Vieh durch einen Fluss geführt, während sie die blasphemische Zeremonie über sich ergehen lassen mussten.\nIhr könnt Euch nur vorstellen, welche Art der Demütigungen die ausländischen Priester ihnen zufügten, aber Ihr seid sicher, dass es nur eine Frage der Zeit ist, bis der Schatten des Kreuzes auch [Root.Capital.GetName] erreicht.
column6: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] y todos sus nuevos conversos sin agallas se reunieron en [converting_king.Capital.GetName] para que los bautice un sacerdote [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName].\nEl pueblo de [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName], antes orgulloso, fue conducido a un río como el ganado, mientras una ceremonia blasfema tenía lugar sobre ellos.\nNi te imaginas a qué indignidades les habrán sometido los sacerdotes extranjeros, pero ya solo es cuestión de tiempo que la sombra de la cruz llegue a [Root.Capital.GetName].

column2: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] and all of [converting_king.GetHerHis] spineless new converts have reunited at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] to be baptized by a [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priest. \nThe once proud people of [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have been led like cattle through a river while the blasphemous ceremony took place above them. \nYou can only imagine what sort of indignities the foreign priests subjected them to, but you are certain that now it is only a matter of time before the shadow of the cross reaches [Root.Capital.GetName].
column3: [converting_king.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] et tous ses nouveaux convertis sans convictions se sont réunis à [converting_king.Capital.GetName] pour être baptisés par un prêtre [sponsoring_king.GetReligionMasc].\nLe peuple autrefois fier [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] a été mené comme du bétail à un fleuve où a eu lieu la cérémonie blasphématoire.\nVous pouvez seulement imaginer à quel genre d'indignités les prêtres étrangers l'ont soumis, mais vous êtes certain que ce n'est plus qu'une question de temps avant que l'ombre de la croix ne plane au-dessus de [Root.Capital.GetName].
column4: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] und alle [converting_king.GetHerHis]er rückgratlosen neuen Konvertierten haben sich in [converting_king.Capital.GetName] getroffen, um von einem [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName]en Priester getauft zu werden.\nDas einst stolze Volk von [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] wurde wie Vieh durch einen Fluss geführt, während sie die blasphemische Zeremonie über sich ergehen lassen mussten.\nIhr könnt Euch nur vorstellen, welche Art der Demütigungen die ausländischen Priester ihnen zufügten, aber Ihr seid sicher, dass es nur eine Frage der Zeit ist, bis der Schatten des Kreuzes auch [Root.Capital.GetName] erreicht.
column6: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] y todos sus nuevos conversos sin agallas se reunieron en [converting_king.Capital.GetName] para que los bautice un sacerdote [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName].\nEl pueblo de [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName], antes orgulloso, fue conducido a un río como el ganado, mientras una ceremonia blasfema tenía lugar sobre ellos.\nNi te imaginas a qué indignidades les habrán sometido los sacerdotes extranjeros, pero ya solo es cuestión de tiempo que la sombra de la cruz llegue a [Root.Capital.GetName].

column2: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] and all of [converting_king.GetHerHis] spineless new converts have reunited at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] to embrace the sun god. \nAccording to most accounts, the foreign priests have forced all the people reunited for the ceremony to give away all their possessions to the golden statue of their greedy new god in a most humiliating display.\nYou can only imagine what sort of indignities the foreign priests subjected them to, but you are certain that now it is only a matter of time before this new religion forces its way to [Root.Capital.GetName].
column3: [converting_king.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] et tous ses nouveaux convertis sans convictions se sont réunis à [converting_king.Capital.GetName] pour embrasser le dieu du soleil.\nSelon les récits de l'événement, les prêtres étrangers ont obligé les gens présents à laisser tous leurs biens à la statue en or de leur nouveau dieu cupide. Un spectacle des plus humiliants.\nVous pouvez seulement imaginer à quel genre d'indignités les prêtres étrangers les ont soumis, mais vous êtes certain que ce n'est plus qu'une question de temps avant que cette nouvelle religion s'impose à [Root.Capital.GetName].
column4: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] und alle [converting_king.GetHerHis]er rückgratlosen neuen Konvertierten haben sich in [converting_king.Capital.GetName] getroffen, um dem Sonnengott zu huldigen.\nDen meisten Berichten zufolge, haben die ausländischen Priester alle, die sich für die Zeremonie gesammelt haben, dazu gezwungen, ihre Besitztümer der goldenen Statue ihres gierigen neuen Gotten in einer demütigen Zurschaustellung zu übergeben.\nIhr könnt Euch nur vorstellen, welche Art der Demütigungen die ausländischen Priester ihnen zufügten, aber Ihr seid sicher, dass es nur eine Frage der Zeit ist, bis die neue Religion ihren Schatten auch auf [Root.Capital.GetName] wirft.
column6: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] y todos sus nuevos conversos sin agallas se reunieron en [converting_king.Capital.GetName] para adoptar el dios del sol. \nSegún la mayoría de los relatos, los sacerdotes extranjeros obligaron a que toda la gente reunida para la ceremonia entregase todas sus posesiones a la estatua dorada de su nuevo dios en una exhibición humillante.\nNi te imaginas a qué indignidades les habrán sometido los sacerdotes extranjeros, pero ya solo es cuestión de tiempo que esta nueva religión se abra paso en [Root.Capital.GetName].

column2: Only the [Root.GetProperReligiousHead] is fit to crown me!
column3: Seul le [Root.GetProperReligiousHead] est apte à me couronner !
column4: Nur der [Root.GetProperReligiousHead] ist in der Lage, mich zu krönen!
column6: ¡Solo el [Root.GetProperReligiousHead] es digno de coronarme!

column2: Send for the most powerful [Root.GetBishopTitleName] in the realm!
column3: Faites venir le plus puissant évêque du pays !
column4: Bittet den mächtigsten Bischof im Reich!
column6: ¡Haced llamar al obispo más poderoso del reino!

column2:
To [Root.GetTitledName],
I shall be glad to legitimize your divine right to rule, as soon as you recognize that the Church is no servant to any King or Emperor, but instead watches over the salvation of the souls of all those in the faith, regardless of their stature. 

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] made good use of my money: the holy walls have been filled to the brim with wine and whores. Soon after the start of the celebration for my upcoming coronation, the crowd of lechers and drunks invited to the party are already debasing themselves in the most abominable acts imaginable.

I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as host of vassals surrounds us in complete silence. The [Root.GetProperReligiousHead] blesses me before placing the Imperial Crown upon my head and proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de vassaux nous entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape me bénit avant de placer la couronne impériale sur ma tête et de me proclamer [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: Ich kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst segnete mich, während er sich darauf vorbereitete, die Kaiserkrone auf mein Haupt zu legen und mich durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] zu krönen.
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos nos rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa me bendice y me pone la corona imperial en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as a host of vassals surrounds us in complete silence. The [Root.GetProperReligiousHead] blesses me and places the Royal Crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de vassaux nous entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape me bénit avant de placer la couronne royale sur ma tête et me proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: Ich kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst segnete mich, legte die Krone auf mein Haupt und verkündete durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] meine Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos nos rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa me bendice y me pone la corona real en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as a host of vassals surrounds us in complete silence. The [coronation_priest.GetTitle] blesses me and places the crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de vassaux nous entourent dans un silence complet. [coronation_priest.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] me bénit, place la couronne sur ma tête et me proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: Ich kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. [coronation_priest.GetDerDie] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] segnete mich, setzte die Krone auf mein Haupt und verkündete durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] meine Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos nos rodea en un silencio absoluto. [coronation_priest.GetElLaCap] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] me bendice y me pone la corona en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] in the empty hall of my palace and, after a quick blessing, the [coronation_priest.GetTitle] summarily and places the crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] dans la grande salle vide de mon palais et, après une rapide bénédiction, [coronation_priest.Get_only_le_Title][coronation_priest.GetTitle] me bénit, place sommairement la couronne sur ma tête et me proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: Ich kniete in der leeren Halle meines Palastes vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] nieder und nach einem kurzen Segen setzte [coronation_priest.Getderdie] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] kurzerhand die Krone auf meinen Kopf und krönte mich durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] en un salón vacío de palacio y tras una bendición rápida, el [coronation_priest.GetTitle] me pone precipitadamente la corona en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kneels before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] host of Electors and vassals surrounds them in complete silence. The [Root.GetProperReligiousHead] blesses [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] before placing the Imperial Crown upon [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName]'s head and proclaiming [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of the Romans by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], and protector of all [GetChristendomOrRandom].
column3: [coronation_ruler.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] s'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de princes électeurs et de vassaux les entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] bénit avant de placer la couronne impériale sur sa tête et de [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] proclamer [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de tous les Romains par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod], et protecteur de toute la [GetChristendomOrRandom].
column4: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]er Kurfürsten und Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst segnete [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie], bevor er sich darauf vorbereitete, die Kaiserkrone auf das Haupt von [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName] zu legen und durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] aller Römer und Beschützer aller [GetChristendomOrRandom]en Gläubigen zu machen.
column6: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] se arrodilla ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos y electores les rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa bendice a [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName] antes de ponerle la corona imperial en la cabeza y proclamar[coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de los romanos y protector de la Cristiandad por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kneels before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] host of vassals surrounds them in complete silence. The [Root.GetProperReligiousHead] blesses [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] before placing the Imperial Crown upon [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName]'s head and proclaiming [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

Le Pape [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] bénit avant de placer la couronne impériale sur sa tête et de [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] proclamer [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]er Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst segnete [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie], während er sich darauf vorbereitete, die Kaiserkrone auf das Haupt von [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName] zu legen und [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie] durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] zu krönen.
column6: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] se arrodilla ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos les rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] bendice antes de poner la corona imperial en la cabeza de [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName] y proclamar[coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kneels before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] host of vassals surrounds them in complete silence. The [Root.GetProperReligiousHead] gives the child an encouraging smile as [coronation_priest.GetSheHe] blesses [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] and places the Imperial Crown upon [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] head, proclaiming [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: [coronation_ruler.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] s'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de ses vassaux les entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape fait un sourire d'encouragement à l'enfant, [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] bénit, place la couronne impériale sur sa tête et [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]er Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst schenkte dem Kind noch ein ermutigendes Lächeln, als [coronation_priest.GetSheHe] [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie] segnete, die Kaiserkrone auf [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] Haupt legte und [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]e Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] verkündete.
column6: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] se arrodilla ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos les rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa da al niño una sonrisa de ánimo mientras [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] bendice y [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] pone la corona imperial en la cabeza, proclamándo[coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

Le Pape [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] bénit, place la couronne royale sur sa tête et [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]er Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst segnete [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie], legte die Krone auf [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] Haupt und verkündete [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]e Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

El papa [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] bendice y [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] pone la corona real en la cabeza, proclamándo[coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

Der Papst schenkte dem Kind noch ein ermutigendes Lächeln, als [coronation_priest.GetSheHe] [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie] segnete, die Krone auf [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] Haupt legte und coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]e Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] verkündete.
